Synergia Capital Partners emerged as the preferred capital partner (via an MBO).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jirin', 'last_name': 'van Santen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project finance | M&A | Renewable energy at Ventolines'}]}, {'title': 'Sale of Bloksma to GEA Group', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'description': 'Managed a international sales proces for the shareholders of Bloksma, a manufacturer of heat-exchangers and intercoolers for marine engines, and oil coolers and double-pipe coolers for various industrial processes. The company was acquired by GEA Group AG, an international technology group that focuses on the specialty mechanical engineering areas of process technology and components. Consolidated sales were EUR 5.2 billion in 2007. GEA Group is listed in the German MDAX share index (G1A, WKN 660200).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jirin', 'last_name': 'van Santen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project finance | M&A | Renewable energy at Ventolines'}]}, {'title': 'Sale NRF to Banco Products', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Together with our M&A International partner office in New York, TM Capital, we approached more than 150 international strategic and financial players, creating a competitive process. As a result our client, Proliance International Inc. (AMEX: PLI), successfully sold 100% of the shares in Nederlandse Radiateuren Fabriek B.V. (NRF), an aftermarket and OEM manufacturer and distributor of a complete range of heat-transfer products, to Banco Products Ltd., an Indian, publicly listed manufacturer and supplier of engine cooling components and engine sealing gaskets to the global commercial and industrial automotive market.

The transaction was completed pursuant to Section 363 of the U.S. bankruptcy code. A ‘stalking horse’ agreement, which Proliance entered into, produced competitive bids from two strategic buyers from India and China. Both Asian parties were very interested to obtain control over NRF’s broad European distribution and state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities. During the final sale auction held in New York both parties contended heavily in this last and crucial phase. Banco Products won this auction and successfully acquired NRF for EUR 17.7 million.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jirin', 'last_name': 'van Santen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project finance | M&A | Renewable energy at Ventolines'}]}]
